Key Match Events: Shai Gilgeous-Alexander recorded a triple-double with 33 points, 11 rebounds, and 6 assists
Jaylen Brown posted 21 points on 8-for-12 shooting in the first half
Aaron Wiggins contributed 15 points for Oklahoma City
Lu Dort hit a corner triple and a late shot-clock layup in the third quarter
Isaiah Hartenstein scored a dunk after a Gilgeous-Alexander block on Tatum
Post-Match Reflections: Shai Gilgeous-Alexander played the part of a superstar against Boston
The Thunder had to fend off the Celtics until the final buzzer
Miscellaneous Highlights: OKC extended its winning streak to 15 games
The high-intensity defense and physicality on that end made hitting shots from the perimeter challenging for both teams
The Thunder had difficulty making perimeter shots all season long, but improved in the fourth quarter
Boston struggled with perimeter shooting all game, especially in the fourth quarter
